course_title: Pain and clinical sciences in musculoskeletal and sports and exercise physiotherapy

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of evidence-informed practice and advanced clinical reasoning in musculoskeletal and sports and exercise physiotherapy.
Understand different types of pain and underlying mechanisms.
Describe and demonstrate the use of patient-reported and clinical outcome measures of pain, function and disability in the assessment and treatment of sports and musculoskeletal injuries.
Demonstrate an in depth understanding and awareness of person-centred care/practice.
Demonstrate an in depth understanding of when a client should be referred to other health care professionals.

assessments.task_description: Students are required to analyse one of four cases, and provide a case formulation exploring the different biological, psychological and social contributors to the patient's pain presentation. Students must then provide an analysis of this case formulation and planned assessments from this. They will then design a management plan based on their case formulation and projected assessment findings.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment items will attract a penalty of 10% of the mark per day late or, for work graded on a 1-7 scale, a deduction of one grade per day (including weekends and public holidays), unless a formal extension has been organised prior to the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will select a spinal condition (from a list of topics), and present a 5-minute presentation that demonstrates their understanding of the relevant research surrounding the evidence-based management of the condition.

Presentations will be pre-recorded by students, using the powerpoint slide template provided.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The video recording and powerpoint file are to be submitted via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment items will attract a penalty of 10% of the mark per day late or, for work graded on a 1-7 scale, a deduction of one grade per day (including weekends and public holidays), unless a formal extension has been organised prior to the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be required to provide a written report of a case study based on a challenging patient with an upper or lower limb condition that they have treated this year.

The report will include a body chart of symptoms and key clinical exam findings, as well as an outline and discussion of the patho-mechanical basis for their specific presentation, and clinical reasoning behind the assessment and chosen treatment / management.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment items will attract a penalty of 10% of the mark per day late or, for work graded on a 1-7 scale, a deduction of one grade per day (including weekends and public holidays), unless a formal extension has been organised prior to the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
